I think it's a given that many posters are tied at the hip to their favorite media sources, in particular TV and talk radio, for opinion formulation and current administration claims to ignore polls. Here's a article where even the WSJ, one of administration's staunchest supporters, suggests elected Republicans will be distancing themselves from the president due to his growing unpopularity:
 
 http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Front_Page/GI17Aa02.html 
 
 The upcoming three years could prove to be one of the longest periods of political dissension in US political history.
The 2006 mid term elections are going to be very interesting times in what is normally a boring campaign.

Republicans have already distanced themselves from Bush and his Social Security 'reform', and after his 'The government will pay for the Katrina damage' speech, fiscally conservative Republicans are also looking to get off the neo-con boat.
 Too bad the Democrats still look like a deer in the headlights instead of a real opposition party, but I guess when the Bush tax cuts for the wealthy also benefit the leadership of the Democratic party any real opposition is hard to find.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Bush popularity
